intro: Phaseolus coccineus var. semperbracteolatus, commonly known as the ever-bracteolate scarlet runner bean, is a variant of the scarlet runner bean characterized by its persistent bracts. It is a herbaceous annual legume native to the Americas, typically growing to a height of 2–3 meters. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers, followed by cylindrical pods containing edible seeds. Its leaves are palmately divided with three to five leaflets, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. This variety is valued for both its ornamental appeal and culinary use in various cuisines.
